Narrative:
The customer was traveling on a two lane, country road, which was missing lane markings on the sides of the road - only the middle line was properly marked. The speed limit on the country road is 35MPH. The customer noticed a pothole on the side of the road, swerved towards the middle of the road to avoid it, but the LKA assist engaged and moved the vehicle back in the lane. By doing so, the vehicle ran over the pothole, with both front and back passenger side tires and damaged both wheel and tires in the process. During our investigation, we determined that in this case the LKA worked as intended. The system is designed to prioritize a solid line, and can't detect a pothole, and since the road is very narrow (our estimate is less than 3m per side) the vehicle unfortunately ran over the pothole. LKA/ELK system limitations throughout the industry are similar: the LKA/ELK systems try to keep vehicle inside the lane, to prevent a vehicle from drifting out, and the system can't predict driver intention, for example: Is the driver crossing solid lane intentionally or by accident, is hard to distinguish. Relevant override conditions in this case are:
- Steering wheel speed  200deg/s
- Steering torque  3.5Nm
In our application, the override force is limited by the EU homologation test and therefore, we feel that the vehicle behaved as expected and should have been over-powered by the driver to avoid the pothole, thus eliminating a costly replacement cost of two wheels and tires.

State or Local Permit: WA AV Certification and SDOT AV Permit
Narrative: A Zoox vehicle in autonomy was traveling in the left travel lane of westbound [XXX] between [XXX] and [XXX] while passing a parked wide delivery truck, when a passenger car traveling ahead in the right lane abruptly steered into the Zoox travel lane without using a turn indicator. The Zoox vehicle braked aggressively in autonomy and the safety operator disengaged and conducted additional manual braking, but the collision was unavoidable. The driver of the passenger car left the scene without exchanging information. The Zoox vehicle sustained moderate damage. There were no injuries reported and the police were not called.

State or Local Permit: WA AV Certification and SDOT AV Permit
Narrative: A Zoox vehicle in autonomy was stopped at a stop sign on southbound [XXX] at [XXX] waiting for a crossing vehicle to clear the intersection, when it was rear-ended by an e-scooter rider. The e-scooter rider initially passed the slowing Zoox vehicle while traveling on northbound [XXX], but then made a mid-block U-turn and rode into the rear of the then-stopped Zoox vehicle in a visibly deliberate manner. The contact resulted in minor scratches on the rear bumper of the Zoox vehicle. The e-scooter rider did not initially indicate that they were injured, and the Zoox operator drove through the intersection to a safe pullover location to assess the damage however, the e-scooter rider later indicated that their "foot hurts". The Police and EMS were then called to the scene, and the e-scooter rider apparently received medical attention and was released. This update provides complete information to date for this incident.

State or Local Permit: WA AV Certification and SDOT AV Permit
Narrative: A Zoox vehicle in autonomy was stopped at a stop sign on southbound [XXX] at [XXX] waiting for a crossing vehicle to clear the intersection, when it was rear-ended by an e-scooter rider. The e-scooter rider initially passed the slowing Zoox vehicle while traveling on northbound [XXX], but then made a mid-block U-turn and rode into the rear of the then-stopped Zoox vehicle in a visibly deliberate manner. The contact resulted in minor scratches on the rear bumper of the Zoox vehicle. The e-scooter rider initially communicated to the Zoox safety operator that they were not injured, and the Zoox operator drove through the intersection to a safe pullover location to assess the damage however, the e-scooter rider later indicated that they were injured. The Police and EMS were then called to the scene, but the e-scooter operator refused medical attention when the ambulance arrived.
